title: Pavlov's Dog - 1976 - Live Detroit  Michigan
description: Pavlov&#039;s Dog formed in St. Louis in 1972 out of the ashes of a local cover band called High on a Small Hill, with Surkamp, formerly of the minor folk-rock act Touch, on vocals and guitar, joined by lead guitarist Steve Scorfina; keyboardist David Hamilton; Mellotron and flute player Doug Rayburn; bassist Rick Stockton; drummer Mike Safron; and strings specialist Siegfried Carver (born Richard Nadler), who added violin, viola, and an odd hybrid instrument called a vitar (that sounded something like Eddie Phillips&#039; bowed guitar in the &#039;60s freakbeat heroes the Creation). The combination of flute, Mellotron, violin, and Scorfina&#039;s guitar heroics led to some comparisons to David Cross-era King Crimson, though Pavlov&#039;s Dog had a much more straight-ahead, less twisty sound.
